accessibility_first_development.content: All React components must be built with ADA compliance as a core requirement, not an afterthought
implementation_approach: Use accessibility utilities from utils/accessibility.ts for consistent ARIA patterns
Include proper semantic HTML structure in all components
Implement keyboard navigation support for all interactive elements
Add screen reader announcements for dynamic content changes
Use Material-UI components with built-in accessibility features
Test with axe-core automated testing during development
required_patterns: All forms must use formUtils.generateFieldProps() for consistent labeling
All tables must use tableUtils.generateHeaderProps() and tableUtils.generateCellProps()
All interactive elements must meet 44px minimum touch target size
All dynamic content must use focusUtils.announce() for screen reader updates
All modals and dialogs must implement proper focus trapping
testing_requirements: axe-core runs automatically in development mode
Manual keyboard navigation testing for each component
Screen reader testing with NVDA, JAWS, or VoiceOver
Color contrast validation for all UI elements

mobile_first_responsive_design.content: All React components must use mobile-first responsive design principles
implementation_approach: Use responsive utilities from utils/responsive.ts for consistent breakpoints
Design for mobile (320px+) first, then enhance for larger screens
Use Material-UI breakpoint system for responsive behavior
Implement touch-friendly interfaces with appropriate sizing
Test on actual devices, not just browser responsive tools
required_patterns: All components must work on mobile (320px-768px) as primary experience
Use useMediaQuery() hook for conditional rendering based on screen size
Implement card layouts for mobile, table layouts for desktop when appropriate
Use responsive typography scaling across breakpoints
Ensure horizontal scrolling is minimized or eliminated

breakpoint_strategy.xs (0-600px): Mobile phones - card layouts, stacked forms, hamburger navigation
breakpoint_strategy.sm (600-900px): Large phones/small tablets - 2-column grids, expanded navigation
breakpoint_strategy.lg (1200px+): Desktop - full feature set, optimal spacing

implementation_approach: Use Django's built-in get_FIELD_display() methods in serializers for single-choice fields
Create custom SerializerMethodField for MultiSelectField choices with manual lookup
Import choice constants locally in serializer methods to avoid circular imports
Provide both raw value (for programmatic use) and display value (for UI) in API responses

MultiSelectField choices require custom get_FIELD_display() method implementation
Choice constants must be imported within serializer methods, not at module level
Frontend components must use '_display' fields for user-facing text

django_serializer.multi_select: def get_field_display(self, obj): from metadata.models import FIELD_CHOICES; field_dict = dict(FIELD_CHOICES); return [field_dict.get(value, value) for value in obj.field]

benefits: Database-level filtering (efficient - only loads needed data)

implementation_pattern.filter_queryset_method: def filter_queryset(self, request, queryset, view): return queryset.filter(...)

when_to_use: Performance-critical filters that benefit from database-level execution
Filters that might be reused across multiple endpoints

internal_api_security.description: Strict group-based security model for internal API endpoints requiring explicit group membership
internal_api_security.context: Four user roles with Django Groups: Admin (superuser), Archivist (staff+group), Museum Staff (group only), Read-Only (group only). Users WITHOUT group assignment are DENIED all access.

permission_implementation.view_access: Staff/superuser OR user in 'Archivist', 'Museum Staff', or 'Read-Only' group
permission_implementation.edit_access: Staff/superuser OR user in 'Archivist' or 'Museum Staff' group
permission_implementation.no_group_behavior: Authenticated users WITHOUT group assignment receive 403 Forbidden
permission_implementation.authentication: Django session-based authentication with CSRF protection

user_role_mapping.administrators: Django superusers (is_staff=True, is_superuser=True) - full Django admin + API access (view/edit/delete), no group required
user_role_mapping.archivists: Django staff users (is_staff=True) + 'Archivist' group - Django admin + full API access (view/edit/delete)
user_role_mapping.museum_staff: Non-staff users (is_staff=False) + 'Museum Staff' group - API edit access only (view/edit, NO delete, NO Django admin)
user_role_mapping.read_only: Non-staff users (is_staff=False) + 'Read-Only' group - API view-only access (NO edit, NO delete, NO Django admin)
user_role_mapping.no_group: Authenticated but no group - DENIED all API access with 403 Forbidden

api_behavior.get_requests: Users with view access (in any of the three groups OR staff/superuser) can list and retrieve data
api_behavior.post_requests: Users with edit access (Archivist or Museum Staff groups OR staff) can create new records
api_behavior.patch_put_requests: Users with edit access (Archivist or Museum Staff groups OR staff) can update existing records
api_behavior.delete_requests: Users with delete access (Archivist group OR superuser) can delete records
api_behavior.permission_failure: Returns 403 Forbidden for unauthorized access or modification attempts
api_behavior.no_group_failure: Returns 403 Forbidden with message indicating group assignment required

frontend_implications.read_only_users: Can view all data, browse items, use search and filters - NO edit/create/delete buttons shown
frontend_implications.museum_staff_users: Can view and edit all data, use in-place editing, create records - NO delete buttons shown
frontend_implications.archivist_users: Can view, edit, create, and delete all data - all buttons and controls shown
frontend_implications.no_group_users: See error message: 'Your account is not assigned to a user group. Please contact an administrator...'

ui_adaptation.hasViewAccess: Checks for group membership before allowing page access

ui_adaptation.hasDeleteAccess: Checks for Archivist group or superuser to show/hide delete buttons

security_benefits.explicit_assignment: Administrators must consciously assign users to groups - no accidental access
security_benefits.three_tier_control: View/edit/delete separation provides granular access control
security_benefits.admin_separation: Museum Staff cannot access Django admin interface (is_staff=False)

security_benefits.role_flexibility: Easy to add/remove users from groups, three groups cover all common use cases
security_benefits.clear_error_messages: Users without groups receive clear instructions on what to do

react_callback_timing_patterns.content: Critical patterns for proper timing of React callbacks to prevent infinite loops
react_callback_timing_patterns.conversation_reference: Date field infinite loop debugging - discovered render-time callback issue

infinite_loop_prevention.root_cause: Callbacks that update state being called during render phase create infinite re-render cycles
anti_patterns: Calling state-updating callbacks directly in JSX render (e.g., {onCallback && onCallback(value)})
Side effects during component render without useEffect
State updates triggered by render-time calculations
correct_patterns: Call callbacks in event handlers (onChange, onClick, etc.)
Use useEffect for side effects based on state changes
Separate render logic from side effect logic

callback_placement_rules.event_handlers: Primary location for callbacks - onChange, onClick, onBlur, etc.
callback_placement_rules.use_effect: For callbacks that should run when dependencies change
callback_placement_rules.never_in_render: Never call state-updating callbacks directly in JSX render phase
callback_placement_rules.conditional_execution: Use conditional logic in event handlers, not render

debugging_methodology: Look for callbacks being called in JSX render (not in event handlers)
Check for state updates happening during render phase
Add console.log to identify render vs event-driven execution
Trace state update chains to find circular dependencies

design_for_end_state_first.content: When implementing multiple related features, design the final architecture first, then implement incrementally
design_for_end_state_first.principle: Plan complete architecture upfront to ensure clean integration, then implement features one at a time for testing
benefits: Avoids refactoring between each feature implementation
Ensures consistent naming and structure across related features
Identifies shared utilities and patterns early
Cleaner final code than piecemeal approach with refactoring

stub_classes_for_model_deprecation.content: When removing widely-used model classes, create stub classes to prevent cascading failures in legacy code
stub_classes_for_model_deprecation.use_case: Legacy Django template views reference deleted models but are no longer actively used (React-only frontend)
benefits: Avoids deleting hundreds of lines of legacy code immediately
Allows gradual cleanup of deprecated code paths

hybrid_clickable_links_pattern.content: List components should use hybrid navigation - proper React Router links on primary identifiers combined with clickable rows for convenience
hybrid_clickable_links_pattern.conversation_reference: UI enhancements session - enabling right-click and new tab workflows
hybrid_clickable_links_pattern.problem: MUI Link components with component='button' and onClick handlers don't support browser right-click context menus
hybrid_clickable_links_pattern.solution: Use React Router Link components for identifiers with stopPropagation to prevent row click conflict
user_experience_benefits: Power users can right-click identifier for 'Open in new tab'
Ctrl/Cmd+Click on identifier opens in new tab
Regular users can still click anywhere on row for quick navigation
Works on mobile with long-press context menu
accessibility_benefits: Proper <a> tags instead of buttons for semantic HTML
Screen readers announce identifiers as links with descriptive labels
Keyboard users can Tab to links and Ctrl+Enter for new tabs
when_to_use: When users might want to reference multiple records simultaneously
When power users need multi-tab workflows
When screen reader semantics are important
hybrid_clickable_links_pattern.anti_pattern: Using component='button' with onClick for navigation - breaks right-click, accessibility, and SEO

django_url_routing_with_react_spa.content: Pattern for Django URL routing with React SPA catch-all while preserving backend routes
django_url_routing_with_react_spa.conversation_reference: URL routing fix for /admin and /api paths in production
django_url_routing_with_react_spa.problem: React SPA catch-all route intercepts backend paths like /admin (without trailing slash) before Django's APPEND_SLASH middleware can redirect
django_url_routing_with_react_spa.solution: Add explicit redirect rules for backend paths without trailing slashes before the catch-all pattern

implementation.order_critical: Backend routes > Explicit redirects > React catch-all (MUST BE LAST)
implementation.negative_lookahead: Uses (?!...) to exclude specific prefixes from catch-all

url_routing_order: 1. Django admin at path('admin/', admin.site.urls) - matches /admin/ with trailing slash
2. API routes at path('api/', ...) - matches /api/ and all sub-paths
3. Django template routes at path('django/', ...) - legacy template interface
4. React home at path('', ReactAppView) - matches root / exactly
5. Explicit redirects at re_path(r'^admin$', ...) - matches /admin without slash, redirects to /admin/
6. React catch-all at re_path(r'^(?!...).*$', ReactAppView) - matches everything else except excluded prefixes

append_slash_interaction.issue: Django's APPEND_SLASH=True middleware redirects /admin to /admin/, but catch-all intercepts before redirect happens
append_slash_interaction.solution: Explicit redirect rules run before catch-all, manually implementing APPEND_SLASH behavior for critical backend paths

safety_check_in_reactappview.purpose: Additional safety net if URL routing fails
safety_check_in_reactappview.implementation: Check request.path against backend prefixes, return 404 if matched
safety_check_in_reactappview.should_never_trigger: If URL patterns are correct, this safety check should never execute

production_vs_development.development: Both Django (8000) and React dev server (3000) can run, but React dev server should be stopped to test Django routing
production_vs_development.production: Only Django serves both API and React build, routing must work correctly
